article_text:
ISTANBUL—Turkey's economy beat growth expectations on Tuesday as recovering euro-zone demand helped fuel exports and steady government spending before March local elections underpinned investments.

Gross domestic product jumped by an annualized 4.3% in the first quarter, the Turkish Statistical Institute said Tuesday, trumping the 4.1% rise forecast by economists surveyed by The Wall Street Journal.

Strong growth in the first...

twitter.description: GDP jumped by an annualized 4.3% in the first quarter, while the ECB's recent stimulus measures mean Turkey can expect more economy-boosting capital inflows.
twitter.title: Turkish Growth Beats Expectations

image.alt: Turkey's first quarter growth, at an annualized 4.3%, beats economists' expectations
